sn50.1-12:4.3: The powers of faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi, and wisdom.
sn50.1-12:4.5: The Ganges river slants, slopes, and inclines to the east.
sn50.1-12:4.6: In the same way, a mendicant who develops the five powers slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.
sn50.1-12:4.7: And how does a mendicant who develops the five powers slant, slope, and incline to extinguishment?
sn50.1-12:4.8: It’s when a mendicant develops the powers of faith, energy,
sn50.1-12:4.11: and wisdom, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn50.1-12:4.12: That’s how a mendicant who develops the five powers slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.” (To be expanded as in SN 45.92–102.)
sn50.1-12:7.1: Six on slanting to the east,
sn50.1-12:7.2: and six on slanting to the ocean;
sn50.1-12:7.4: and that’s how this chapter is recited.
